CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial
JUDGES: Giovanni Bonello;Lech Garlicki;Ledi Bianku;Nebojša Vučinić;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Chief of the ORG ( GPE PERSON ) dismissed the applicant from the police service ( he was held accountable for accepting bribes ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Chief of ORG ( ORG ) upheld the decision .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the GPE prosecution authorities charged the applicant , a serving police officer at the time , with numerous counts of fraud .
CARDINAL . On DATE a bill of indictment against the applicant and CARDINAL other suspects was lodged with ORG ( Sąd Rejonowy ) .
CARDINAL . The applicant did not submit any information concerning the court ’s hearings DATE .
CARDINAL . QUANTITY hearings , scheduled on DATE and DATE , were adjourned as some of the suspects failed to appear .
CARDINAL . QUANTITY hearings , scheduled on DATE and DATE , were cancelled due to the judge ’s illness .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court severed the charges against the applicant and CARDINAL other accused .
CARDINAL . Subsequently , the trial court held hearings on CARDINAL and DATE , CARDINAL DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE , and CARDINAL DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , CARDINAL and DATE and DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG convicted the applicant as charged and sentenced him to DATE and CARDINAL months’ imprisonment and a fine of MONEY ( PLN ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE his appeal was dismissed by ORG ( PERSON ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a complaint under LAW on complaints about a breach of the right to a trial within a reasonable time ( LOC o skardze na naruszenie prawa strony do rozpoznania sprawy w postępowaniu sądowym bez nieuzasadnionej zwłoki ) ( “ the CARDINAL Act ” ) and asked for just satisfaction .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG dismissed his complaint . It limited its examination of the length of proceedings issue to the period after the entry into force of LAW and stressed that the LAW could not be applied to the protracted length of court proceedings occurring before that date . Having analysed the conduct of ORG during the period after the entry into force of LAW , ORG found that there were no delays for which ORG could be held responsible . Pointing to the complexity of the case and the voluminous documentation gathered in the proceedings it held that the proceedings had been conducted with due diligence and within a reasonable time .

CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law and practice concerning remedies for the excessive length of judicial proceedings , in particular the applicable provisions of LAW , are stated in the ORG ’s decisions in the cases of ORG v. GPE no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ( dec . ) , § § DATE , ECHR CARDINAL-V and NORP v. GPE no . CARDINAL ( dec . ) , ORG CARDINAL-VIII and the judgment in the case of PERSON v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , ORG CARDINAL
